intro: Galarhoeus creticus, commonly known as the Cretan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
